title: PRM-PACK-0025: push/pull data-fabric wrappers
description:
Implement deferred pack push/pull subcommands as thin data-fabric wrappers.

## Acceptance Criteria
- push publishes pack by pack_id idempotently.
- pull fetches pack by ID and materializes manifest + members to --out.
- Transport/server failures map to refusal envelope (exit 2).

## Notes
No new domain logic in wrappers.

title: PRM-PACK-0024: diff subcommand implementation
description:
Implement deferred pack diff command.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Compares two pack manifests for added/removed/changed members deterministically.
- Exit 0 when no changes, exit 1 when differences exist.
- Supports human and --json outputs with deterministic ordering.

## Notes
Deferred until core seal/verify path is stable.

title: PRM-PACK-0017: seal test suites
description:
Implement focused seal tests for determinism and contract correctness.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Deterministic member ordering and manifest output asserted with golden snapshots.
- pack_id reproducibility validated across repeat runs.
- Duplicate path collisions and empty-input refusals covered.

## Notes
Scope excludes verify/witness tests.

title: PRM-PACK-0026: Homebrew/tap release parity
description:
Implement Homebrew/tap release parity if distribution strategy requires it.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Release process updates formula/metadata deterministically with checksums.
- Version bump and artifact URLs are reproducible and testable.
- Failure modes include explicit retry instructions.

## Notes
Deferred until core release workflow is stable.

title: PRM-PACK-0002: manifest model + canonical serialization
description:
Implement typed pack.v0 manifest model and deterministic canonical JSON serialization.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Manifest struct covers version/pack_id/created/note/tool_version/members/member_count.
- Canonical serializer is deterministic across runs and platforms.
- pack_id placeholder workflow supports self-hash computation.

## Notes
Foundation for seal and verify.

title: PRM-PACK-0009: seal command orchestration
description:
Wire full pack seal command flow end-to-end.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Executes collect -> collision check -> copy/hash -> type detect -> manifest finalize.
- Supports --output and --note options.
- Emits PACK_CREATED outcome with exit 0 on success.

## Notes
All refusal mappings should route through shared refusal layer.

title: PRM-PACK-0004: artifact collection + path normalization
description:
Implement deterministic artifact discovery for pack seal inputs.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Accepts files and recursively walks directories.
- Produces deterministic member candidates sorted by bytewise path order.
- Member path normalization is stable and relative to pack root contract.

## Notes
Input collection only; no copying/hashing yet.

title: PRM-PACK-0020: CI quality gates + test matrix
description:
Establish CI baseline parity with rvl standards.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Adds CI workflow at .github/workflows/ci.yml for pull_request and push-to-main.
- CI runs formatting, lint, and test gates (cargo fmt --check, cargo clippy -- -D warnings, cargo test) with explicit versions or targets.
- CI output includes brief local reproduction commands for failed gates.

## Notes
Keep fan-out reasonable for early-stage repo.

title: PRM-PACK-0005: duplicate member collision detection
description:
Detect path collisions in resolved member set before copy.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Duplicate member path collisions are detected deterministically.
- Collisions refuse with E_DUPLICATE and source detail.
- No partial copy occurs after collision detection failure.

## Notes
Depends on normalized member paths from collection step.

title: PRM-PACK-0008: pack_id computation + manifest writer
description:
Implement manifest finalization and pack_id self-hash computation.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Manifest built with pack_id="" before hashing.
- Canonical JSON used to compute sha256 pack_id deterministically.
- manifest.json written to output pack root with final pack_id.

## Notes
Critical integrity contract bead.

title: PRM-PACK-0011: verify schema checks for known artifacts
description:
Extend verify to schema-validate known JSON members.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Known member artifacts (lock/report/etc) validated against available schemas when present.
- Schema failures reported as INVALID findings (exit 1), not refusals.
- Validation behavior deterministic with clear finding codes.

## Notes
Best-effort for known types only.

title: PRM-PACK-0014: operator manifest + --describe
description:
Implement compiled-in operator.json and --describe path.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Embedded operator manifest matches plan contract and subcommands.
- --describe prints manifest and exits 0 before input validation.
- Manifest refusal map and exit semantics are accurate.

## Notes
No network behavior claims beyond deferred scope.

title: PRM-PACK-0018: verify test suites
description:
Implement focused verify tests for OK/INVALID/REFUSAL outcomes.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Valid pack verifies OK (exit 0).
- Tampered/missing members and pack_id mismatch produce INVALID (exit 1) findings.
- Malformed or unreadable pack directories refuse (exit 2).

## Notes
Includes JSON output assertions.

title: PRM-PACK-0022: README parity with rvl style
description:
Upgrade README to rvl-level usability and depth.

## Acceptance Criteria
- README begins with a concise what/why section and a Quickstart block with copy-paste commands for pack seal, pack verify, and pack witness last.
- Includes at least one successful flow example (exit 0) and one refusal example (exit 2) with expected outcome wording.
- Documents v0.1 boundaries explicitly (diff, push, pull deferred) and witness defaults (no-witness behavior).

## Notes
Friendly up top, deep technical sections lower.

title: PRM-PACK-0019: refusal + witness test suites
description:
Implement refusal envelope and witness behavior integration tests.

## Acceptance Criteria
- All refusal codes validated with deterministic detail payloads.
- witness append/no-witness behavior tested for seal and verify.
- witness query/last/count behavior tested with synthetic ledgers.

## Notes
Avoid duplicating seal/verify business tests.

title: PRM-PACK-0007: member type detection
description:
Implement type detection and artifact_version extraction for members.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Type mapping follows plan contract for known version markers (lock/report/rules/profile/etc).
- Unknowns map to type=other deterministically.
- artifact_version populated when version markers are available.

## Notes
No schema validation yet.

title: PRM-PACK-0010: verify command integrity checks
description:
Implement pack verify for membership and hash integrity validation.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Validates manifest presence/parse, member_count consistency, member existence, member hashes, and recomputed pack_id.
- Returns exit 0 for OK, exit 1 for INVALID integrity findings, exit 2 for refusal errors.
- Supports human and --json outputs.

## Notes
Schema validation of known member types is tracked separately.

title: PRM-PACK-0012: witness append policy
description:
Implement ambient witness recording for pack command outcomes.

## Acceptance Criteria
- seal and verify append witness records by default.
- --no-witness suppresses writes without changing domain exits.
- Witness write failures warn on stderr and do not alter domain result.

## Notes
Do not record witness query subcommands.

title: PRM-PACK-0015: --schema output
description:
Implement --schema output for pack.v0 and verify schema discovery behavior.

## Acceptance Criteria
- --schema prints valid JSON Schema and exits 0 before input validation.
- Schema captures manifest and member contracts used by seal/verify.
- Regression test validates schema shape and required fields.

## Notes
Runtime contract discovery parity bead.

title: PRM-PACK-0013: witness query CLI
description:
Implement pack witness query/last/count subcommands.

## Acceptance Criteria
- query/last/count work against ledger with deterministic filtering.
- Human and --json output supported for witness queries.
- Empty/no-match behavior follows spine witness conventions.

## Notes
Depends on witness ledger model from append policy bead.

title: PRM-PACK-0003: refusal system + envelope
description:
Implement refusal codes and envelope output for pack.v0.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Codes implemented: E_EMPTY, E_IO, E_DUPLICATE, E_BAD_PACK.
- Refusal envelope emitted on stdout with exit code 2.
- Detail payloads are deterministic and testable.

## Notes
No command-specific business logic beyond mapping.

title: PRM-PACK-0021: release workflow parity with rvl
description:
Implement release workflow parity for pack.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Adds tag-driven release workflow file at .github/workflows/release.yml (trigger on version tags) that builds deterministic pack artifacts.
- Workflow publishes artifacts to a GitHub Release and is idempotent for re-runs on the same tag.
- Failure output is actionable (clear failing step plus reproduction hint) and changelog or release-note generation is automated.

## Notes
Homebrew/tap parity tracked separately.

title: PRM-PACK-0023: AGENTS.md swarm coordination contract
description:
Create AGENTS.md with explicit multi-agent coordination rules for pack repo.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Includes a kickoff checklist requiring AGENTS and README read-through before coding and explicit br ready guidance for next-task selection.
- Contains reservation policy with concrete allowed and forbidden examples (specific files allowed; broad globs and directories forbidden).
- Includes instruction to expect concurrent local edits from other agents and avoid destructive commands while reconciling.

## Notes
Documentation/process bead only.

title: PRM-PACK-0016: fixture corpus
description:
Build deterministic fixture corpus for seal/verify/refusal scenarios.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Fixtures include valid artifacts, nested dirs, duplicate-name inputs, and tampered packs.
- Fixture README maps each fixture to intended test families.
- Fixture bytes are stable and reusable across unit/integration tests.

## Notes
Data-only bead.

title: PRM-PACK-0006: member copy + bytes hashing
description:
Implement byte-for-byte member copy into output directory and member sha256 computation.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Copied bytes are identical to source bytes for every member.
- bytes_hash recorded as sha256:<hex> for each copied member.
- Copy and hashing behavior is deterministic across runs.

## Notes
Exclude manifest from member set.

title: PRM-PACK-0001: scaffold crate + CLI surface
description:
Build crate skeleton and clap subcommand tree for pack.

## Acceptance Criteria
- src/main.rs + src/lib.rs with run() -> u8 exit mapping.
- CLI includes seal/verify/witness and deferred stubs for diff/push/pull.
- Global flags wired: --describe, --schema, --version, --no-witness.

## Notes
Plumbing only; no domain logic.
